global_governance.escalation_policy: Failure at any section -> escalate to supervisor

sections.theoretical_basis: Task Analysis (Jonassen); Hierarchical Task Analysis; Cognitive Task Analysis
validation_criteria: Each atomic objective is independently measurable
Dependencies are explicit and non-circular
Hierarchy covers all aspects of original goal
Time estimates are attached to leaf objectives
sections.description: Framework defining how complex learning goals are decomposed into atomic, measurable objectives with clear dependency relationships.

sections.theoretical_basis: Bloom's Revised Taxonomy (Anderson & Krathwohl); SOLO Taxonomy (Biggs & Collis); Fink's Taxonomy of Significant Learning
validation_criteria: Bloom level is unambiguous (single level)
SOLO level is consistent with Bloom
Knowledge dimension matches objective verbs
Fink categories support holistic learning
sections.description: Framework defining how learning objectives are classified using established taxonomies to guide assessment and instruction design.

sections.theoretical_basis: Cognitive Load Theory (Sweller); Element Interactivity; Affective Load in Learning
validation_criteria: Complexity score accounts for learner baseline
Time estimate is realistic for context
Affective demand considers personality (N threshold)
Supervision level matches institutional constraints
sections.description: Framework defining how objective difficulty is quantified considering cognitive demand, affective load, and learner context.

sections.theoretical_basis: Mastery Learning (Bloom); Criterion-Referenced Assessment; Observable Behavior Objectives (Mager)
validation_criteria: Uses observable action verbs (not 'understand', 'know')
Specifies conditions under which performance occurs
Defines minimum acceptable performance level
Evidence requirements are feasible to collect
sections.description: Framework defining how measurable success criteria and mastery thresholds are established for each learning objective.

sections.theoretical_basis: Learning Hierarchies (Gagn√©); Prerequisite Relationships; Knowledge Space Theory
validation_criteria: All dependencies are explicit in prerequisite graph
No circular dependencies exist
Readiness checks are feasible to administer
Sequence respects all prerequisite constraints
sections.description: Framework defining how prerequisite knowledge and skills are identified, mapped, and validated before new learning proceeds.

sections.theoretical_basis: Self-Determination Theory (Deci & Ryan); Expectancy-Value Theory (Wigfield & Eccles); Interest Theory (Hidi & Renninger)
validation_criteria: Connection to learner goals is explicit
RIASEC alignment considered for career relevance
Personality preferences (E, O) inform modality selection
Autonomy is preserved where possible
sections.description: Framework defining how learning objectives are connected to learner values, interests, and intrinsic motivation sources.

sections.theoretical_basis: Constructive Alignment (Biggs); Assessment FOR Learning (Wiliam); Authentic Assessment
validation_criteria: Assessment type matches Bloom/SOLO level
Formative checkpoints occur at key learning moments
Feedback is actionable and timely
Stakes are appropriate for learning context
Personality preferences inform assessment modality
sections.description: Framework defining how valid, reliable assessment strategies are designed to measure objective achievement.

sections.theoretical_basis: System Integration Principles; Interface Contract Design; Pedagogical Agent Coordination
validation_criteria: CogniStruct spec includes theory alignment requirements
CSA spec includes sequencing constraints and content requirements
MSA spec includes modality preferences and context constraints
Assessment intent includes L06 handoff metadata
Personality context is included for downstream personalization
sections.description: Framework defining how complete objective specifications are packaged for downstream pedagogical agents (CogniStruct, CSA, MSA, L06).
